name.text: Calculating the area of a rhombus, given the height and base

questiontext.text:
Find the area of the figure below.

[[jsxgraph]] (function() { const board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-1, 6, 10, -2], axis: false, showNavigation: false, keepaspectratio: false, showCopyright: false }); // Coordinates chosen so that: // side length = 5 units (representing 5 cm) // perpendicular height = 4 units (representing 4 cm) // A(0,0), B(5,0), C(8,4), D(3,4) const A = board.create('point', [0, 0], {name: 'A', fixed: true, visible: false ,size: 3}); const B = board.create('point', [5, 0], {name: 'B', fixed: true, visible: false ,size: 3}); const C = board.create('point', [8, 4], {name: 'C', fixed: true, visible: false ,size: 3}); const D = board.create('point', [3, 4], {name: 'D', fixed: true,visible: false , size: 3}); // Rhombus polygon const rhombus = board.create('polygon', [A, B, C, D], { borders: { strokeWidth: 2 }, fillColor: '#f0f8ff', fillOpacity: 0.5 }); // Draw perpendicular height from D to base AB // Foot of perpendicular E is (3,0) const E = board.create('point', [3, 0], {name: 'E', visible: false, size: 2, face: 'o'}); const heightSegment = board.create('segment', [D, E], {dash: 2, strokeWidth: 2, strokeColor: 'blue'}); // Draw a visible right angle marker at E (manually as a small square) const RA1 = board.create('point', [E.X(), E.Y()], {visible: false}); const RA2 = board.create('point', [E.X() + 0.4, E.Y()], {visible: false}); const RA3 = board.create('point', [E.X() + 0.4, E.Y() + 0.4], {visible: false}); const RA4 = board.create('point', [E.X(), E.Y() + 0.4], {visible: false}); board.create('polygon', [RA1, RA2, RA3, RA4], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black', strokeWidth: 1}, fillColor: 'black', fillOpacity: 0.3 }); // Label side lengths "5 cm" on each side (placed at midpoints) function midLabel(P, Q, text) { const midx = (P.X() + Q.X()) / 2; const midy = (P.Y() + Q.Y()) / 2; return board.create('text', [midx, midy, text], {anchorX: 'middle', anchorY: 'bottom', fontSize: 14}); } midLabel(C, D, '{#Base#} cm'); // Label the perpendicular height (4 cm) near the segment board.create('text', [3.2, 2, '{#Height#} cm'], {fontSize: 14}) // Make sure labels stay readable if board is resized board.on('resize', function() { board.update(); }); })(); [[/jsxgraph]]

\(\text{Area of the Rhombus}=\)[[input:ans1]] \(\text{cm}^2\) [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
The area of a rhombus is given by:
\( \text{Area} = \text{Base} \times \text{Height} \)

Given that:
\(\text{Base} = {@Base@}\,\text{cm}\)
\(\text{Height} = {@Height@}\,\text{cm}\)

Substitute the given values into the formula to get the area as shown below.

\( \begin{align} \text{Area of a rhombus} &= \text{Base} \times \text{Height} \\ &= {@Base@} \times {@Height@} \\ &= {@area@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

Therefore:
\(\text{The area of the rhombus} = {@area@}\,\text{cm}^2\)
